v.v: Woe to those who are at ease in Zion,
Your leaders say, “Go to Kalneh and look;
Woe to those who put off the day of disaster
They lie on beds of ivory
They sing foolish songs to the music of the harp;
So they will now go into exile with the first exiles,
“I, the Lord Yahweh, have sworn by myself—
It will come about that if there are ten men left in one house, they will all die.

When a man’s relative comes to take their bodies up—the one who is to cremate them after bringing the corpses out of the house—if he says to the person in the house, “Is there anyone with you?” What if that person says, “No.” Then he will say, “Be quiet, for we must not mention Yahweh’s name.”
For, look, Yahweh will give a command,
Do horses run on the rocky cliffs?
You who rejoice over Lo Debar,
“But look, I will raise up against you a nation,

v: and to those who are secure in the hill country of Samaria,
the notable men of the best of the nations,
to whom the house of Israel comes for help!
from there go to Hamath, the great city;
then go down to Gath of the Philistines.
Are they better than your two kingdoms?
Is their border larger than your border?”
and make the throne of violence come near.
and lounge on their couches.
They eat lambs from the flock
and calves from the stall.
they improvise on instruments as David did.
and anoint themselves with the finest oils,
but they do not grieve over the ruin of Joseph.
and the feasts of those who lounge about will pass away.
this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh, the God of hosts,
I detest the pride of Jacob;
I hate his fortresses.
Therefore I will deliver up the city with all that is in it.”
and the big house will be smashed to pieces,
and the little house to bits.
Does one plow there with oxen?
Yet you have turned justice into poison
and the fruit of righteousness into bitterness.
who say, “Have we not taken Karnaim by our own strength?”
house of Israel—this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh, the God of hosts.
They will afflict you
from Lebo Hamath to the brook of the Arabah.”
